intro: Phlomoides franchetiana, commonly known as the Franchet's phlomoides, is a flowering plant native to parts of East Asia, particularly China. It belongs to the family Lamiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant typically features slender, erect stems and produces small, clustered flowers in shades of purple or pink. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Phlomoides franchetiana is often found in moist, open habitats such as meadows and forest edges.
